Package pcb.uwu.core

Class BigDecimal2DAmount

  • java.lang.Object
    • pcb.uwu.core.BigDecimal2DAmount
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Amount<BigDecimal2DAmount>

    public class BigDecimal2DAmount
extends Object
implements Amount<BigDecimal2DAmount>
    An implementation of Amount for bi-dimensional values based on java.lang.BigDecimal representations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  BigDecimal2DAmount.Dimension2D
      The dimensions of a tri-dimensional amount Can either be seen as [A, B] or as [X, Y]

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public BigDecimal getValue​()
        The scalar representation of this Amount. If the Amount is uni-dimensional it returns the underlying Amount. If the Amount is multi-dimensional it returns the norm of the Amount.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface Amount<BigDecimal2DAmount>
        Returns:
        the underlying value

      • getValue

        public BigDecimal getValue​(Amount.Dimension<BigDecimal2DAmount> dimension)
        The scalar representation of this Amount. If the Amount is uni-dimensional it returns the underlying value. If the Amount is multi-dimensional it returns the value of the selected dimension.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface Amount<BigDecimal2DAmount>
        Parameters:
        dimension - the dimension to consider
        Returns:
        the underlying value

      • getScale

        public int getScale​()
        The scale of this Amount. If the Amount is uni-dimensional it returns it's scale. If the Amount is multi-dimensional it returns the largest scale of it's individual dimensions.
        Specified by:
        getScale in interface Amount<BigDecimal2DAmount>
        Returns:
        the scale of the Amount

      • withScale

        public BigDecimal2DAmount withScale​(int scale,
                                    RoundingMode roundingMode)
        Set the scale of the Amount. If the Amount is multi-dimensional all dimensions will be affected with the new scale.
        Specified by:
        withScale in interface Amount<BigDecimal2DAmount>
        Parameters:
        scale - the new scale to set
        roundingMode - the rounding mode
        Returns:
        a new Amount with the new scale
